title: Introducing: Grudle Bay Riots
body:
I seem to have become something of an obsessive of the Oxford music scene recently.

It all started unassumingly with those loveable pop tykes **[Alphabet Backwards](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/10545-live-review-alphabet-backwards-upstairs-at-the-o2-oxford-200811/ "I dun a live review of 'em...")**_,_ a band I really shouldn’t like but really kind of do, who in turn introduced me to the mighty **[Spring Offensive](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/9750-live-review-spring-offensive-the-ashmolean-oxford-050811-2/ "I also did a live review of these guys. Told you I cared.")**, easily one of my favourite musical discoveries of the year. And now I find myself sniffing around **[Grudle Bay Riots](https://www.facebook.com/#%21/group.php?gid=175689658588 "Grudle Bay Facebook")**, or Abingdon-based duo **Nathan Allsworth** and **Tom Hodges**. The pair function as the linchpin of a fluid musical collective – occasionally they might be joined by **Alphabet** drummer **Paul Davidson**, **[Winchell Riots](http://www.thewinchellriots.co.uk/ "They're also named after some riots...contentious?!")** (oh look, another ace Oxford band…) sticksman **James Pamphlion**, drum machinist (and sibling) **James Allsworth**, or keyboardist **Tom Dyson**. In any case, new track _Fool Around_ marries understated glitch to some gorgeous delay antics, by way of a soulful, chilled out vocal. I’m seriously looking forward to more output from these guys, and hopefully after hearing _Fool Around_, you will be too.

 [Fool Around- Live from the bedroom](http://soundcloud.com/grudlebayriots/fool-around-live-from-the) by [Grudle Bay](http://soundcloud.com/grudlebayriots)
